Package org.firstinspires.ftc.teamcode.pedroPathing.pathGeneration

Class BezierCurve

java.lang.Object
org.firstinspires.ftc.teamcode.pedroPathing.pathGeneration.BezierCurve
Direct Known Subclasses:
BezierLine, BezierPoint
public class BezierCurve extends Object
This is the BezierCurve class. This class handles the creation of Bezier curves, which are used as the basis of the path for the Path class. Bezier curves are parametric curves defined by a set of control points. So, they take in one input, t, that ranges from [0, 1] and that returns a point on the curve. Essentially, Bezier curves are a way of defining a parametric line easily. You can read more on Bezier curves here: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/BÃ©zier_curve

    This creates a new Bezier curve with some specified control points and generates the curve.

  • Constructor Details

    • BezierCurve

      public BezierCurve()
      This creates an empty BezierCurve. IMPORTANT NOTE: Only use this for the constructors of classes extending this. If you try to run the robot on a Path containing an empty BezierCurve, then it will explode.

    • BezierCurve

      public BezierCurve(ArrayList<Point> controlPoints)
      This creates a new BezierCurve with an ArrayList of control points and generates the curve. IMPORTANT NOTE: The order of the control points is important. That's the order the code will process them in, with the 0 index being the start point and the final index being the end point
      Parameters:
      controlPoints - This is the ArrayList of control points that define the BezierCurve.

    • BezierCurve

      public BezierCurve(Point... controlPoints)
      This creates a new Bezier curve with some specified control points and generates the curve. IMPORTANT NOTE: The order of the control points is important. That's the order the code will process them in, with the 0 index being the start point and the final index being the end point.
      Parameters:
      controlPoints - This is the specified control points that define the BezierCurve.

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize()
      This handles most of the initialization of the BezierCurve that is called from the constructor.

    • initializeDashboardDrawingPoints

      public void initializeDashboardDrawingPoints()
      This creates the Array that holds the Points to draw on the Dashboard.

    • getDashboardDrawingPoints

      public double[][] getDashboardDrawingPoints()
      This returns a 2D Array of doubles containing the x and y positions of points to draw on FTC Dashboard.
      Returns:
      returns the 2D Array to draw on FTC Dashboard

    • generateBezierCurve

      public void generateBezierCurve()
      This generates the Bezier curve. It assumes that the ArrayList of control points has been set. Well, this actually generates the coefficients for each control point on the Bezier curve. These coefficients can then be used to calculate a position, velocity, or accleration on the Bezier curve on the fly without much computational expense. See https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/BÃ©zier_curve for the explicit formula for Bezier curves

    • getEndTangent

      public Vector getEndTangent()
      This returns the unit tangent Vector at the end of the BezierCurve.
      Returns:
      returns the end tangent Vector.

    • approximateLength

      public double approximateLength()
      This approximates the length of the BezierCurve in APPROXIMATION_STEPS number of steps. It's like a Riemann's sum, but for a parametric function's arc length.
      Returns:
      returns the approximated length of the BezierCurve.

    • getPoint

      public Point getPoint(double t)
      This returns the point on the Bezier curve that is specified by the parametric t value. A Bezier curve is a parametric function that returns points along it with t ranging from [0, 1], with 0 being the beginning of the curve and 1 being at the end. The Follower will follow BezierCurves from 0 to 1, in terms of t.
      Parameters:
      t - this is the t value of the parametric curve. t is clamped to be between 0 and 1 inclusive.
      Returns:
      this returns the point requested.

    • getCurvature

      public double getCurvature(double t)
      This returns the curvature of the Bezier curve at a specified t-value.
      Parameters:
      t - the parametric t input.
      Returns:
      returns the curvature.

    • getDerivative

      public Vector getDerivative(double t)
      This returns the derivative on the BezierCurve that is specified by the parametric t value. This is returned as a Vector, and this Vector is the tangent to the BezierCurve.
      Parameters:
      t - this is the t value of the parametric curve. t is clamped to be between 0 and 1 inclusive.
      Returns:
      this returns the derivative requested.

    • getSecondDerivative

      public Vector getSecondDerivative(double t)
      This returns the second derivative on the BezierCurve that is specified by the parametric t value. This is returned as a Vector, and this Vector is the acceleration on the BezierCurve.
      Parameters:
      t - this is the t value of the parametric curve. t is clamped to be between 0 and 1 inclusive.
      Returns:
      this returns the second derivative requested.

    • getApproxSecondDerivative

      public Vector getApproxSecondDerivative(double t)
      Because, for whatever reason, the second derivative returned by the getSecondDerivative(double t) method doesn't return the correct heading of the second derivative, this gets an approximate second derivative essentially using the limit method. I use this for its heading only.
      Parameters:
      t - this is the t value of the parametric curve. t is clamped to be between 0 and 1 inclusive.
      Returns:
      this returns the approximated second derivative.

    • getControlPoints

      public ArrayList<Point> getControlPoints()
      Returns the ArrayList of control points for this BezierCurve.
      Returns:
      This returns the control points.

    • getFirstControlPoint

      public Point getFirstControlPoint()
      Returns the first control point for this BezierCurve.
      Returns:
      This returns the Point.

    • getSecondControlPoint

      public Point getSecondControlPoint()
      Returns the second control point, or the one after the start, for this BezierCurve.
      Returns:
      This returns the Point.

    • getSecondToLastControlPoint

      public Point getSecondToLastControlPoint()
      Returns the second to last control point for this BezierCurve.
      Returns:
      This returns the Point.

    • getLastControlPoint

      public Point getLastControlPoint()
      Returns the last control point for this BezierCurve.
      Returns:
      This returns the Point.

    • length

      public double length()
      Returns the approximate length of this BezierCurve.
      Returns:
      This returns the length.

    • UNIT_TO_TIME

      public double UNIT_TO_TIME()
      Returns the conversion factor of one unit of distance into t-value. Since parametric functions are defined by t, which can mean time, I use "time" in some method names for conciseness.
      Returns:
      returns the conversion factor.

    • pathType

      public String pathType()
      Returns the type of path. This is used in case we need to identify the type of BezierCurve this is.
      Returns:
      returns the type of path.
